metadata.title: CVE-2018-11099 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The header::add_INFO_descriptor function in header.cpp in VCFtools 0.1.15allows remote attackers to cause information disclosure (heap-based bufferover-read) via a crafted vcf file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vcftools - 0.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vcftools package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
